channel.description: Frameplay helps software companies achieve sustained growth through customer-centric practices.

item.title: Applying Jobs to be Done to Packaging and Pricing
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hill
item.description:
Once you understand the customer’s desired progress and what it’s worth to him to make that progress, you can start to understand the value your feature offers. This is a much better anchor of price than any sort of cost- or market-based calculation.

The post Applying Jobs to be Done to Packaging and Pricing appeared first on Innovation & New Product Development | Frameplay | Ottawa, Canada | JTBD : Design Thinking : Workshops.

item.title: Jobs to be Done: A Theory With a Mysterious Past
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hill
item.description:
The first time I heard about Jobs to be Done it made perfect sense. It was almost TOO obvious. We don’t buy products, we buy them for what they help us do. As a product designer and innovator, I was excited about how this view of the world could help the companies I worked for, …

Continue reading "Jobs to be Done: A Theory With a Mysterious Past"

The post Jobs to be Done: A Theory With a Mysterious Past appeared first on Innovation & New Product Development | Frameplay | Ottawa, Canada | JTBD : Design Thinking : Workshops.

item.title: Nine Things to Consider Before Setting Up Your Jobs to be Done Interviews
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hill
item.description:
Jobs to be Done interviews (JTBD interviews) are a great way to gather unique customer insights you can use to transform your business – if done correctly. The theory behind Jobs to be Done is that customers have progress they want to make in their lives. They hire products and services they believe will help …

The post Nine Things to Consider Before Setting Up Your Jobs to be Done Interviews appeared first on Innovation & New Product Development | Frameplay | Ottawa, Canada | JTBD : Design Thinking : Workshops.

item.title: Top 5 “Jobs To Be Done” Mistakes Product People Make
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hill
item.description:
Innovators, product managers and marketers alike are embracing the Jobs to be Done mindset to design and sell products customers love. Jobs to be Done: customers have progress they want to make in their lives. They hire products and services they believe will help them get the job done (under specific circumstances). There is no …

The post Top 5 “Jobs To Be Done” Mistakes Product People Make appeared first on Innovation & New Product Development | Frameplay | Ottawa, Canada | JTBD : Design Thinking : Workshops.

item.title: Not every industry is ripe for disruption. And that’s ok.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hill
item.description:
The average age of a company on the S&P 500 is plummeting! Disrupt or be disrupted! You need to pursue a Blue Ocean Strategy at all costs! If you’re not scared, you’re not paying attention!! More than ever before, business decisions are being made out of fear. Not being bold means quietly accepting our fate, …

Continue reading "Not every industry is ripe for disruption. And that’s ok."

The post Not every industry is ripe for disruption. And that’s ok. appeared first on Innovation & New Product Development | Frameplay | Ottawa, Canada | JTBD : Design Thinking : Workshops.
